Event Description: A mandatory coordination meeting for Session Coordinators, Assistant Coordinators, and Wellness Coordinators to receive weekly duty assignments and provide input. The agenda typically includes a spiritual thought, roll call, duty distribution, interview sign-ups, and a review of session-specific information.
A brief gathering to account for all staff members before transitioning to the Session Adviser Message.
A mandatory meeting for all staff where the Session Adviser presents an uplifting message for their enrichment and edification to help them in their roles.
A transition time for Assistant Coordinators and Counselors to move to their breakout session locations.
Assistant Coordinators (ACs) meet with the Counselors (CNs) they supervise to build relationships, define FSY expectations, distribute necessary paperwork, and answer questions.

Event Name: Mingle | Meet Your Co-CN | CN Interviews | Door Tag Prep
Event Description: A multi-purpose time for staff to mingle, for co-counselors to meet and plan, for individual Counselor interviews with ACs to be conducted, and for preparing personalized door tags for participant rooms.
A breakfast for all staff members to start the day together.
A brief transition to the Staff Business Meeting.

A mandatory meeting for staff to receive announcements, discuss agenda changes, review session-specific information, and receive a briefing for check-in procedures. ACs and WCs announce their duties for the week.
Co-counselors meet to plan and discuss how they will carry out activities and assignments for the week, such as "Meet Your Company," home evening, and gospel study.
Under the direction of the Check-in Coordinator, staff help prepare the check-in area by organizing name cards, wristbands, and participant kits.
The first shift for participant arrival and check-in. Staff are expected to be professional and welcoming, directing any questions about room changes to the Solutions Table.
The second shift for participant arrival and check-in. Staff continue to provide a welcoming experience and direct specific questions to the Solutions Table.
A transition time to conclude check-in and prepare for participant room checks.
Counselors, along with participants, check rooms for any pre-session damage and report it. This time also serves as an opportunity for youth to get acquainted.

The first meeting where Counselors interact with their youth. This is an opportunity to set a tone of love, discuss standards and rules, and conduct the first head count. Please fill out the pizza ordering form here: https://forms.office.com/pages/responsepage.aspx?id=m278xvtRqEi3eZ7lZLQEEyQ4eCGxr49LviNofbdtoxdUM1BPREU4TVYxTFA0Q0UwQjFaNVY4Tk9HRy4u&route=shorturl
Participants and counselors travel to their designated company meeting spots.
An activity designed to create unity and allow youth to get to know each other through various get-to-know-you games.
The company discusses its assigned name and scripture to build unity. Counselors also teach the company a simple chant to be used throughout the week.
All companies travel together to the main orientation location.
This meeting serves to excite the youth about the week, introduce the leadership team, and share crucial information. The Session Adviser will also reinforce the Code of Conduct.
Dinner for all participants and staff. Staff are encouraged to help youth behave appropriately and stay in approved areas.

Event Name: Meet with Company & Travel to Home Evening
Event Description: Companies meet for a head count before traveling together to the home evening lesson.
The FSY theme is formally introduced by the Session Adviser in a lesson that teaches the importance of following the prophet's counsel and reinforces gospel principles.
Companies travel to their designated spots for games and goal-setting activities.
Counselors lead their companies in selected games, followed by a debriefing to connect the games to gospel principles.
An activity to unify the company by setting both personal and company goals that encourage unity, service, and spiritual growth for the week.
A designated time for movement back to the dorms for the nightly routine.

Event Name: Head Count, Reflect & Review, Journaling, Prayer
Event Description: A nightly routine where youth ponder and process the day's experiences, record their thoughts, and share testimonies to better understand what Heavenly Father is teaching them.

Event Name: Quiet Time - Get Ready for Bed
Event Description: A time for youth to relax, visit with others, and prepare for bed while counselors monitor the hallways to ensure participants do not leave their floor.
The official time for lights to be out. Participants must be in their rooms, though roommates are permitted to talk quietly as long as they do not disturb others.
An opportunity for youth to engage in physical activity like jogging or stretching in a safe and supervised environment.
A daily morning meeting for Assistant Coordinators and Counselors to receive announcements, get instruction, and pray together.
A devotional led by participants on a topic from "For the Strength of Youth: A Guide for Making Choices".
Breakfast for all participants and staff.
A daily opportunity for youth to increase their love of the scriptures, learn how they can bless their lives, and develop a habit of daily study.
Movement to the location for the morning devotional.
An uplifting lesson presented by the Session Adviser that focuses on and further develops the FSY theme.
Movement to the various classroom locations.
A class focused on learning how to receive personal revelation.
Movement between the various classroom locations.
A class focused on how to find answers to gospel questions.
Lunch for all participants and staff.
Movement to the various classroom locations.
General class time for various gospel topics.
Movement between the various classroom locations.
General class time for various gospel topics.
A period of free time for participants to choose their own on-campus activities, with dinner available during this time. It is an opportunity for Counselors to spend time with their participants.
A company activity designed to help youth learn about the benefits and costs of technology and to set goals for using it for good, based on the principles of Purpose, Plan, and Pause.
A time for companies to prepare their banner and a cheer of approximately one minute for the cheer-off competition later in the week.
A review of FSY dance standards and social etiquette to ensure a wholesome social experience where the Spirit can be present.
A fun and energetic dance where all counselors are expected to help maintain dance standards and encourage participation in a wholesome atmosphere.
Movement to the dorms.

Event Name: Head Count, Reflect & Review, Journaling, Prayer
Event Description: A nightly routine of headcount, reflection on the day's events, journaling, and a company prayer.

Event Name: Quiet Time - Get Ready for Bed
Event Description: A designated time for participants to wind down and prepare for bed.
The official time for all lights to be out in the dorms.
Time for participants to exercise.
A meeting for Assistant Coordinators and Counselors.
A devotional led by the participants.
Breakfast for all participants and staff.
Personal and group gospel study time for participants.
Movement to the location for the morning devotional.
A short, spiritual devotional by the Session Advisor to start the day.
Movement to the various classroom locations.
General class time for various gospel topics.
Movement between the various classroom locations.
General class time for various gospel topics.
Lunch for all participants and staff.
Movement to the various classroom locations.
General class time for various gospel topics.
Movement between the various classroom locations.
General class time for various gospel topics.
A block of free time for participants to choose their own activities.
Preparation for games night.
Movement to the location for games night.
An evening activity designed to help youth unite as a company, feel the Spirit while having fun, and step outside their comfort zones through various games and a cheer competition.
Movement to the dorms.
A pizza party for all participants. Counselors are encouraged to maintain an uplifting atmosphere to prepare for the nightly Reflect and Review session.

Event Name: Head Count, Reflect & Review, Journaling, Prayer
Event Description: A nightly routine of headcount, reflection on the day's events, journaling, and a company prayer.

Event Name: Quiet Time - Get Ready for Bed
Event Description: A designated time for participants to wind down and prepare for bed.
The official time for all lights to be out in the dorms.
Time for participants to exercise.
A meeting for Assistant Coordinators and Counselors.
A devotional led by the participants.
Breakfast for all participants and staff.
Personal and group gospel study time for participants.
Movement to the location for the YM/YW Activities.

Event Name: Young Men Morning Devotional and Young Women Activity
Event Description: The young men attend a morning devotional with the Session Adviser, while the young women participate in an activity focused on "The Family: A Proclamation to the World".
Movement between the location for the YM/YW Activities.

Event Name: Young Women Morning Devotional and Young Men Activity
Event Description: The young women attend a morning devotional with the Session Adviser, while the young men participate in an activity focused on "The Family: A Proclamation to the World".
Lunch for all participants and staff.
Reviewing the guidelines for the variety show.
Movement to the location of the variety show.
An opportunity for youth to showcase their diverse talents and skills in a series of short, unrelated acts or performances.
A block of free time for participants to choose their own activities.
A company discussion on the doctrine and purpose of reverence and the nature of a testimony to prepare for the evening's activities.

Event Name: Seating for Musical Program and Evening Devotional
Event Description: Participants and staff get seated for the evening's events.
A 30-minute program where youth share their testimonies through song and spoken word, setting the tone for the evening devotional and testimony meeting.
An evening devotional for all participants.
Following the evening devotional, the Session Adviser invites youth to take time to write their testimonies in their handbooks.
Participants and staff get seated for the testimony meetings.
A sacred meeting where participants have the opportunity to share a personal witness of truth and a humble declaration of what they know and feel about the Savior and His restored gospel.
Movement to the dorms.

Event Name: Head Count, Reflect & Review, Journaling, Prayer
Event Description: A nightly routine of headcount, reflection on the day's events, journaling, and a company prayer.

Event Name: Quiet Time - Get Ready for Bed
Event Description: A designated time for participants to wind down and prepare for bed.
The official time for all lights to be out in the dorms.
Time for participants to exercise.
A meeting for Assistant Coordinators and Counselors.
A devotional led by the participants.
Breakfast for all participants and staff.
Personal and group gospel study time for participants.
Movement to the location for the morning devotional.
A short, spiritual devotional by the Session Advisor to start the day.
Movement to company spots.
An activity to help youth feel inspired to respond to the invitation to gather Israel by preparing to share the gospel, strengthening their families, and making a plan to receive temple blessings.
A debriefing session to discuss experiences with the #ShareGoodness challenge and using technology for good, including a discussion on creating a positive online presence.
Lunch for all participants and staff.

Event Name: Travel to Slide Show and Taking It Home Showcase
Event Description: Movement to the location of the final events.

Event Name: Taking It Home Showcase and Slideshow
Event Description: A final showcase activity to review and celebrate the week and watch the session slideshow, with a focus on highlighting ways the youth can apply the lessons learned at home.
Movement to copmpany spots.
An activity to help youth recognize the impact of setting goals, reflect on what they have learned, celebrate their growth, and feel empowered to continue setting goals at home.

Event Name: Participant Flex Time, Packing, and Dinner
Event Description: A block of free time for participants to engage in on-campus activities, pack their belongings, and have dinner in preparation for returning home.
A time for group pictures.
A fun and energetic dance for all participants.
Gather as a company and review lost and found.
The Session Adviser delivers a final message reflecting on the week's devotional topics and extends the "Do and Become" invitation to encourage lasting change.
Companies travel to their company spots for the last time.
A final company meeting where counselors facilitate a discussion to help youth set and share personal goals for living the gospel when they return home.
Movement to the dorms.

Event Name: Head Count | Quiet Timeâ€”Get Ready for Bed Announcements | Prayer
Event Description: The final nightly routine.
The official time for all lights to be out in the dorms.
FSY staff provide increased supervision by stationing themselves at strategic points to monitor youth dorms and ensure a safe and secure environment throughout the night.
Participants get ready to leave, making sure their belongings are packed and rooms are ready for inspection.
Counselors inspect each participant's room with them, collect all keys, and document any damage or lost keys before the final checkout.
A final, mandatory meeting for all staff to review the week, coordinate departure logistics, ensure all keys are returned, and complete online evaluations.
An optional breakfast for staff members to conclude the session together.
